title: How to Paint PVC Kitchen Cabinets

steps.headline: Take the cabinet doors off hinges with the screwdriver removing all knobs, hardware and drawer fronts as best you can.
steps.description: This will make for a more detailed professional job.

steps.headline: Clean all parts of cabinet with soapy water.
steps.description: Let dry completely wiping dry with rag if necessary.

steps.headline: Sand the cabinet parts to remove finishes.
steps.description: This gives a textured surface helping paint to stick properly.

steps.headline: Clean cabinets again with a dry, clean cloth.
Apply one coat of primer to the cabinet parts using a hard, stiff, natural paintbrush.
steps.description: Let dry for one hour. Apply the second coat of primer to the cabinet with a foam brush in even, long strokes. Let primer dry fully for at least two hours.

steps.headline: Apply one coat of acrylic latex paint of choice color.
steps.description: You may use a roller or a foam brush, or you may use an electric paint sprayer or acrylic latex pray paint,  This gives you less control but leaves less of a 'brush' stroke look. You may apply multiple coats depending on the desired color.

steps.headline: It is wise to apply a thin coat of clear, wipe-on polyurethane varnish to the cabinets to protect them.
steps.description: Apply with a clean rag and let dry completely.

steps.headline: Reassemble the cabinets and you are done.

text: Take the cabinet doors off hinges with the screwdriver removing all knobs, hardware and drawer fronts as best you can. This will make for a more detailed professional job. Clean all parts of cabinet with soapy water. Let dry completely wiping dry with rag if necessary. Sand the cabinet parts to remove finishes. This gives a textured surface helping paint to stick properly. Clean cabinets again with a dry, clean cloth.  Apply one coat of primer to the cabinet parts using a hard, stiff, natural paintbrush. Let dry for one hour. Apply the second coat of primer to the cabinet with a foam brush in even, long strokes. Let primer dry fully for at least two hours. Apply one coat of acrylic latex paint of choice color. You may use a roller or a foam brush, or you may use an electric paint sprayer or acrylic latex pray paint,  This gives you less control but leaves less of a 'brush' stroke look. You may apply multiple coats depending on the desired color. It is wise to apply a thin coat of clear, wipe-on polyurethane varnish to the cabinets to protect them. Apply with a clean rag and let dry completely. Reassemble the cabinets and you are done.
